title: Impute dates and times when data are missing. — impute_dtc
Impute dates and times when data are missing. — impute_dtc
text: data data.frame equivalent object least columns defined details section. na_ntod nominal time day unscheduled measurements imputed ?  (Often 0 selected, missing default.)

title: Impute dates and times when data are missing. — impute_dtc
text: `data` columns "ADTC_IMPUTE_METHOD" "ADTC_IMPUTED"   added.

title: Impute dates and times when data are missing. — impute_dtc
text: Dates times imputed based following rules: date time observed, observed value used. Data assumed grouped appropriate grouping factors within   nominal time times may time, data   assumed sorted order specified protocol. nominal time since first dose (NTSFD) missing, imputation   performed (measure assumed unscheduled). dates differ within nominal time measurement, imputation   performed (data issue appear exist case). one date exists within nominal time measurement, missing dates   assumed match observed date. one time exists within nominal interval, measurements   interval assigned median times exist. Columns used calculation : ADTC: (date time) formatted ISO8601 datetime without time   zone (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss) entire time seconds parts   optional. STUDYID, USUBJID, NTSFD: grouping variables study number, subject   identifier, nominal time since first dose.

title: Impute dates and times when data are missing. — impute_dtc
text: impute_dtc_ntod(): imputes based typical nominal time day (NTOD) subject.

what: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
text: Impute standard deviation measures dispersion.

title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
code: impute_sd(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_sd(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_cv(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_se(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_ci(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_iqr(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)  impute_sd_range(point, var1, var2, n, vartype)

title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
text: point point estimate (measurement central tendency) var1, var2 first second measures dispersion (`var2` required imputation methods) n number observations contributing measurement vartype type dispersion (case insensitive; see Details)

title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
text: vector imputed standard deviations

title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
text: impute_sd selects imputation method based   vartype. impute_sd_sd() imputes standard deviation   (really imputation).  var1 standard deviation;   var2 must NA; vartype must "SD" (ignoring case);   n ignored. impute_sd_cv() imputes standard deviation   coefficient variation (CV).  var1 CV; var2 must   NA; vartype must "CV", "%CV", "CV%" (ignoring case);   n ignored. impute_sd_se() imputes standard deviation   standard error (SE).  var1 standard error mean;   var2 must NA; vartype must "SE" "SEM"   (ignoring case); n required.  Imputation assumes sample,   population, SE. impute_sd_ci() imputes standard deviation   confidence interval (CI).  var1 lower bound CI;   var2 upper bound CI; vartype must match   regular expression "^([0-9]+)% CI$" (ignoring case); n   required.  upper lower bound CI available, set   NA.  Imputation assumes t-distribution. impute_sd_iqr() imputes standard deviation   inter-quartile range (IQR).  var1 lower bound IQR;   var2 upper bound IQR; vartype must "IQR"   (ignoring case); n required.  Imputation assumes   t-distribution. impute_sd_range() imputes standard deviation   range.  var1 lower bound range; var2   upper bound range; vartype must "RANGE" (ignoring case);   n required.  Imputation performed computing (var2   - var2)/4.  last choice imputation methods.

title: Impute standard deviation from measures of dispersion. — impute_sd
text: Cochrane Handbook, version 5.1   https://handbook-5-1.cochrane.org/chapter_7/7_7_3_data_extraction_for_continuous_outcomes.htm

code: join_control(   x,   y,   join_fun,   x_control = "any",   y_control = "any",   x_fraction = NA_real_,   y_fraction = NA_real_,   x_count = NA_integer_,   y_count = NA_integer_,   overlap_fraction = NA_real_,   overlap_count = NA_integer_,   ... )  join_many_to_one(x, y)  join_one_to_one(x, y)

pattern. — join_control
text: x, y tbls join join_fun function can combine x y (called join_fun(x, y, ...)).  Typically one dplyr::left_join, dplyr::right_join, etc. x_control, y_control outcome expected x, y tbls? Default "" (see details). x_fraction, y_fraction, x_count, y_count fraction count rows x y must final data?  Fractions converted row counts rounding nearest integer. overlap_fraction, overlap_count fraction count rows return value must overlap (.e. rows ) x y?  Fractions converted row counts rounding nearest integer. ... Passed join_fun()

title:
Perform join where the outcome of the join is verifed to match an expected
pattern. — join_control
text: joined tbl

title:
Perform join where the outcome of the join is verifed to match an expected
pattern. — join_control
text: Options x_control y_control may   combined: "": outcome acceptable; overrides options. "": row input must appear output least one   time. "unique": row may appear output zero one time. "missing": least one row must match new dataset (values   must missing).  option rarely used. "nomissing": rows must match new dataset (values must   missing). combination x_control=c("", "unique", "nomissing") (y_control) common need confirm values present exactly one time missing values.

title:
Perform join where the outcome of the join is verifed to match an expected
pattern. — join_control
text: join_many_to_one(): common task many--one mapping, helper function `join_many_to_one()` works. join_one_to_one(): common task one--one mapping, helper function `join_one_to_one()` works.

what: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
title: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
text: Convert value something old something new (using gsub)

title: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
code: translate_value(x, old, new, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame translate_value(x, old, new, ..., exclude_col = NULL)  # S3 method for factor translate_value(x, old, new, ...)  # S3 method for character translate_value(x, old, new, ..., fixed = TRUE)  # S3 method for default translate_value(x, old, new, ...)

title: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
text: x object translate old, new old new character strings ... Passed gsub exclude_col vector columns exclude data.frame translation fixed Passed gsub

title: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
text: object old converted new

title: Convert a value from something old to something new (using gsub) — translate_value
text: translate_value(data.frame): Convert columns (unless excluded) translate_value(factor): Convert levels translate_value(character): Use gsub. translate_value(default): translation done.

what: Convert from Unicode to ASCII — unicode_to_ascii
title: Convert from Unicode to ASCII — unicode_to_ascii
text: Convert Unicode ASCII

title: Convert from Unicode to ASCII — unicode_to_ascii
code: unicode_to_ascii(x, ...)  # S3 method for default unicode_to_ascii(x, verbose = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for character unicode_to_ascii(   x,   verbose = FALSE,   pattern = c("μ", "µ"),   replacement = c("u", "u"),   general_conversion = TRUE,   ... )  # S3 method for factor unicode_to_ascii(x, ...)  # S3 method for logical unicode_to_ascii(x, verbose = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame unicode_to_ascii(x, verbose = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for list unicode_to_ascii(x, verbose = FALSE, ...)

title: Convert from Unicode to ASCII — unicode_to_ascii
text: x Object may contain character strings conversion. verbose Provide messages number values changed. pattern, replacement, ... Passed stringi::stri_replace_all_fixed() general_conversion initial, specific conversions, run stringi::stri_trans_general(x, id="-Latin;Greek-Latin;Latin-ASCII") current strings.

title: Convert from Unicode to ASCII — unicode_to_ascii
text: object class x Unicode characters   converted ASCII.
